greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the sum of all parts k in all partitions of n into consecutive parts, (1 <= k <= n).
comment: Iff n is a power of 2 (A000079) then row n lists n - 1 zeros together with n.
Iff n is an odd prime (A065091) then row n lists (n - 3)/2 zeros, (n - 1)/2, (n + 1)/2, (n - 3)/2 zeros, n.
example: For n = 9 there are three partitions of 9 into consecutive parts, they are [9], [5, 4], [4, 3, 2], so the 9th row of triangle is [0, 2, 3, 8, 5, 0, 0, 0, 9].
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Oct 20 2019
